title: Large Deviations and Sum Rules for Spectral Theory - A Pedagogical Approach
abstract:
This is a pedagogical exposition of the large deviation
approach to sum rules pioneered by Gamboa, Nagel and Rouault. We'll explain how to use their ideas to recover the Szegö and Killip-Simon Theorems. The primary audience is spectral theorists and people working on orthogonal polynomials who have limited familiarity with the theory of large deviations.
